docs.text:
OSG Collaborations Support
¶


Mission
¶


The mission of OSG Collaboration support is to enable access and lower the barrier for Midscale collaborations to leverage the
the high throughput computing ecosystem of OSG for their research.




Contact Us
¶


Open a Ticket by sending an email to help@opensciencegrid.org and request support for your collaboration project.




Regular Meeting schedule
¶


Collaboration support holds and participates in meetings during the week to assist and coordinate on projects. A list of the weekly meeting schedule is maintained 
here


List of supported collaboratoins
¶


Collaboration list

docs.text:
REDTOP
¶


Computing Model for REDTOP using OSG resources: https://redtop.fnal.gov/computing-model/




OSG Collaboration Support Services supports REDTOP workflows on the OpenScienceGrid and has provided a compute plan 
in support of the colllaboration's LOI to Snowmass21
docs.title: REDTOP

docs.text:

in support of the colllaboration's LOI to Snowmass21

IceCube-CESER
¶


Icecube is supported by OSG Collaborations via the CESER project. 


By-weekly call details:

Time: 03:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
      Every 2 weeks on Mon

docs.text:
LSST via Duke
¶


LSST is supported by OSG Collaboration Services via the duke.lsst osg project


Sign up to get access to the OSG submit node here: 
Duke CI-Connect Access Portal


News
¶


You can now use stashcp to transfer data to and from OSG as part of your computational workflow. You must transfer your 
input files to a new namespace. 


From your active session on the duke login node the namespace is located in: /collab/users and /collab/project/lsst
Users can create their own private directories in users or shared directories in lsst. New accounts will create the user
directories automatically and provide read,write permissions in the project/lsst folder


To transfer files to a remote site via a job enter this stashcp command in your execution script:


stashcp /osgconnect/collab/users/
/
 .


To transfer files, such as output, from the remote site where your jobs is running to your space on stash, enter 
 this command in your execution script


stashcp 
 stash:///osgconnect/collab/users/
/.
docs.title: LSST

docs.text: LSST is supported by OSG Collaboration Services via the duke.lsst osg project  Sign up to get access to the OSG submit node here:  Duke CI-Connect Access Portal
docs.title: LSST via Duke

docs.text:
You can now use stashcp to transfer data to and from OSG as part of your computational workflow. You must transfer your 
input files to a new namespace.   From your active session on the duke login node the namespace is located in: /collab/users and /collab/project/lsst
Users can create their own private directories in users or shared directories in lsst. New accounts will create the user
directories automatically and provide read,write permissions in the project/lsst folder  To transfer files to a remote site via a job enter this stashcp command in your execution script:  stashcp /osgconnect/collab/users/ /  .  To transfer files, such as output, from the remote site where your jobs is running to your space on stash, enter 
 this command in your execution script  stashcp   stash:///osgconnect/collab/users/ /.
docs.title: News

docs.text:
South Pole Telescope SPT-3G
¶




South Pole Telescope is supported by OSG Collaborations with infrastructure at UC, submit hosts to the OSG, 
and a local condor pool for access to MWT2 and IRISHEP-SSL clusters


Account Portal and sign up for Access to Resources


SPT Local Storage Dashboard


SPT Grid Storage Dashboard




Information fo Users
¶


Guide to access OSG resources


Guid to obtain Grid Certificates


General Information on Software availability and documenation


¶

docs.text:
XENON
¶


Collaboration services supports XENON with local infrastructure and services at UChicago which includes submit/login nodes,
storage (dCache & Ceph), Data Management with Rucio, monitoring, software and documentation


Status of Services
¶


Rucio Server Ganglia


FTS Server Ganglia


Check-mk Xenon Rucio Group


Rucio Postgress


XENON login node


Weekly XENON analysis/Compute call
¶


URL: https://riceuniversity.zoom.us/j/4815153031  


Minutes:https://xe1t-wiki.lngs.infn.it/doku.php?id=xenon:xenon1t:analysistools:200402

URL: https://unl.zoom.us/j/865025296

¶


When: Tuesdays 12:30pm-1:30pm Central  


Details in the IGWN Collaboration page
  


Icecube-CESER meeting
¶


When: Biweeklyy on Mondays 3:00 pm-4:00pm Central


Detais in the Icecube Collaboration page

¶

Details in the XENON Collaboration page
